flag.hlp: Reference to related data compiled in another entry

x4codes.shortRef: Jour: Nucl. Instrum. Methods in Physics Res., Sect.A, Vol.575, p.449 (2007)

x4freetext: Proton-recoil plastic detector, data acquisition system
details.
Flight path 6 m. Time resolution (FWHM) < 700 ps.
energy resolution is between 0.2% and 2% in a neutron
energy range between 0.2MeV and 10MeV.
Transmission.
Superconducting Electron Linac.
Electrons are accelerated up to 40MeV using
Electron Linac for beams with high Brilliance and low
Emittance ELBE.
Bremsstrahlung radiation is induced by impinging
a high intensity electron beam on a liquid lead loop.
Fast neutrons are generated via the (gamma,n)
reactions. Electron bunch < 10 ps. Neutrons are
isotropically emitted from the radiator (about 1 cm**3)
and guided by a conical collimator of entrance diameter
2 cm, length 2.4 m, and exit diameter is 3 cm.
Clearly separated gamma-flash and white neutron
spectra.
Neutrons make only 0.6% of total events for the no
target measurement, 0.6% of total events for the Al-27
measurement and 3.2% of total events for the Ta-181
measurement.
Fast plastic - scintillation material EJ200,
large area stripes of 1000 x 42 x 11 mm3, readout by
two Hamamatsu2 R2059-01 2-inch photomultiplier tubes.
nELBE setup consists of the plastic detectors
for neutron detection and BaF2 detectors for emitted
gamma-rays detection.
2.55 cm thick Ta-181 (99.988%) absorber and 4.00 cm
thick Al-27 (100%) absorber.
Runs changing samples, with and without samples, every
hour.
For conversion dead-time.
M.M.
Request of data was sent to A.Matic - a.matic@fzd.de

Monograph number 138.
Data of G.Rohr and R.B.Schwartz+ were rebind to the
present experiment energy resolution and used for
comparison.
Data are on Fig.3 of J,EPJ/CS,8,07006,2010.
Al-27 data were used for Ta-181 data calibration.
